description: Link or call-to-action text that points users to additional information or help about the registration process.
Main title displayed at the top of the page identifying the voter registration form.

labels: Form subtitle (e.g., powered by Rock the Vote)
description: Subtitle or tagline shown under the main title, often indicating the organization or version.
Legal disclaimer text required by the National Voter Registration Act explaining proof requirements and legal context.
Multi-line introductory instructions explaining that the user is not registered until they sign, stamp, and mail the form, or similar guidance.
Section header label for the instructions box (e.g., INSTRUCTIONS, INSTRUCCIONES).
Paragraph or list introducing the numbered procedure steps for completing the voter registration process.
Text describing how to fold, stamp, and mail the completed voter registration form.
Detailed text for procedure step 1 (e.g., sign the form and ensure signature requirements are met).
Detailed text for procedure step 2, usually about completing or reviewing the registration application.
Detailed text for procedure step 3, typically covering folding, sealing, or preparing the form for mailing.
Detailed text for procedure step 4, such as applying postage or confirming mailing details.
Detailed text for procedure step 5, often reminding users to check deadlines or follow up with their election office.
Header text for the section explaining how and where to mail the completed voter registration form.
Detailed explanation of acceptable identification for registration or first-time voters, including examples (photo ID, utility bill, etc.).
Header label for the section describing registration deadlines.
Text describing voter registration deadlines for the userâ€™s state (e.g., number of days before election, postmark rules).
Header label for the section addressing first-time voters.
Instructions for first-time voters, including additional requirements for those who registered by mail.
Text summarizing that states may have additional requirements and pointing users to state-specific information.
First line of the destination mailing address for where the registration form should be sent (e.g., office name).
Second line of the destination mailing address (e.g., street address or PO Box).
Third line of the destination mailing address (e.g., city, state, ZIP).
Header text for the "Read Me" or important information section.
Body text providing additional notes, disclaimers, or help information related to the registration process.
